messages.title: Labour: A better plan and a better future
messages.content: The choice at this Election is between the Tory Party’s failing plan and a fairer plan for working families with Labour. Labour has a plan for a better future: saving our NHS by investing in the extra staff it so badly needs; creating better opportunities for the next generation, and cutting tax for 24 million working people through a lower starting rate of tax.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour would increase the number of nurses, midwives, care-workers and doctors. We would guarantee a GP appointment within 48 hours, and a maximum one week wait for cancer tests.

Labour will reverse the standards raised by freezing energy bills until 2017, expanding free childcare places to 25 hours for working parents with 3 and 4-year-olds. We will also cut tuition fees to £6,000.
Labour is committed to building 200,000 homes a year by 2020 and will reform the rental market with Councils and Housing Associations building homes at rents ordinary people can afford.

Labour would balance the books and deliver a budget surplus in the next Parliament. We aim to get the economy growing again by ending the underinvestment by the Coalition government and cut the deficit every year.

issues.economy: Labour pledges to get the economy growing again by ending the underinvestment by the Coalition government and cut the deficit every year.
issues.education: Labour will cut tuition fees to £6,000, more apprenticeships and smaller Primary class sizes.
issues.health: Labour would increase the number of nurses, midwives, care-workers, and doctors. We guarantee a GP appointment within 48 hours, and a maximum one week wait for cancer tests.

housing.content: Labour is committed to building 200,000 homes a year by 2020 and will reform the rental market with Councils and Housing Associations building homes at rents ordinary people can afford.

images.caption: Peter Baldrey - Labour's Parliamentary Candidate for North Wiltshire
